content: love letter kindle cover crochet pattern about this pattern spread the love this valentine s day with a simple quick and charming kindle cover whether it s for you or a loved one you can add your own touch of personalisation by experimenting with different yarn colours or adding a fun embroidered touch for a unique one of a kind kindle cozy i would love to see your finished letter so please add it to your raverly project tag me on instagram or facebook you can find my social media handles under the contact section gauge 14 sts by 19 row = 10 x 10cm of single_crochet with 4 5mm hook and aran yarn materials ● yarn - aran colour a for main body dk colour b for heart ● hook - 3mm 4 5mm ● stitch marker ● darning needle ● scissors ● invisible snap fastener - 15mm you can substitute this for any size or material abbreviations - us terms chain - chain mc - magic_ring single_crochet - single_crochet flo - front loop only st/sts - stitch/ stitches slip_stitch - slip_stitch decrease - decrease invisible decrease - insert hook in flo of the next 2 sts single_crochet together increase - increase two single_crochet in the same stitch f/o - fasten_off cut yarn and pull the tail through the loop - total number of stitches at the end of the row x2 - repeat two times x3 - repeat three times x4 - repeat four times * * - repeat the sequence between the stars 1 notes made to fit kindle paperwhite 7th generation the main body is worked in a round where you join the last stitch and first stitch with a slip_stitch then you turn your work and continue working in the round my recommendation is to use a stitch marker to mark the last and first stitch of the row to help you identify the beginning and end without increasing or losing stitches by accident instructions using colour a and 4 5mm hook cover - body r1 chain 24 skip 1 chain single_crochet 22 3 single_crochet into the last st single_crochet 22 on the other side of the chain 3 single_crochet in the last st slip_stitch into first st turn 50 r2 - 23 skip slip_stitch single_crochet 50 slip_stitch turn 50 the following row are worked back and forth instead of in a round to make up the flap cover - flap r24 - 27 single_crochet 26 turn 26 r28 - 39 *place one decrease at the beginning and at the end of the row turn* until you have 2 sts left f/o weave in the end cover - flap s border with the envelope s back side facing up re-attach the yarn in the flap s right hand side corner place a single_crochet into the side of each row of the flap the 2 single_crochet left from row 39 and on the other side of the flap f/o weave in the end 2 using colour
